job_title: Quality Review Specialist in Charlotte, NC
pros: CCME has a great team environment.
cons: There are not many career growth opportunities.

pros: Flexibility is the best part.
cons: Micromanagement is a persistent problem.

job_title: Sterile PRocessing Manager in Charlotte, NC
pros:
Job stability
Stability pay check
Bonus pay for managers linked to your department performance budget & departmental goals!
cons:
This healthcare system is all about making a dollar and cutting back where ever & when ever they can!
You are told who to give political donations to for support; those politicians that support the mission and for profit business of the hospital!  Front line manager are threatened year after year based on Employee Engagement Survery! Human Resources does not support managers at all, they are all the BIGGEST joke! Benefits are the worst ever.  Insurance premiums are HIGH!  Extended illness time taken away.  401 K plan no longer being matched and the list goes on and on!
Trust me you do not want to work within Surgical Services at any of their facilities! Run the other way, in the opposite direction of this place!

review_title: The Company's niche is getting crowded.
pros: Provided employment and a pay check.    Co-workers were good people.
cons: Salary.  Time off.  Limited opportunities for advancement.  No job training.   This job did very little to improve my resume.  There is a revolving door for employees.  Benefits are back end loaded.  It is unlikely that a new hire will be employed long enough to receive most of the benefits.  Benefits have been slashed.  Recent large reduction in force.  Non-existent communication between management and employees.

review_title: Small company which is becoming smaller
pros: Local Cary location. Good amount of parking.  Near Capi's, so quick run out for lunch.  Near US route 1 and Tryon road, so convenient access by car.
cons: Recent large reduction in force.   Recent restructuring. No training.  No advancement opportunities.   Benefits have been reduced.  Sick time has been recently reduced.  Time off - company requires that full time employees take at least 40 hrs of time off per year.

pros: The harder you work the more opportunities you will be given. CCME thrives on staff that are willing to put in the extra time and energy to develop new business and make a committment to the overall success of the company. If you advocate for yourself and take advantage of the opportunities given to you there is ample opportunity for advancement.
cons: Much of the staff, and high level management has been a part of the organization since inception and has little experience in other fields. This makes for a difficult environment for addressing change.

review_title: Good intentions, but potential not realized
pros: Important work for an underserved population, committed staff.
cons: Lack of meaningful communication by management with staff, constantly battling fraud and abuse within the Medicaid system. Very restrictive contracts with CMS.

review_title: Safe Harbor in the employment sea
pros:
Mission of company -  improving quality is admirable.  Good lines of communications.
Good place for nurses looking for second career.
Work life balance is better than previous employers.
cons: Salary. Time off.  Company runs on a precariously thin margin.  Company does not try to retain employees.  Staff up for a project, then after the project goodbye.

pros: Flexibility with schedule, work from home
cons: Low pay, vacation time, upper management

pros: Great mission, passionate team members and outstanding company culture. Over the last year, after years of no raises, moved to a merit based performance management system that allows for annual raises, based on goal attainment
cons: We must be diligent in continuing to attain new contracts and retain those we currently have.

job_title: Appeals and Mediation Specialist in Charlotte, NC
pros: CCME is a great place to work. The environment is wonderful and there unlimited growth potential. Within 6 months, I accepted a job promotion as did 3 other people on our initial team.
cons: Management is not very accessible and needs to create more of an open-door policy

pros: Laid back, Flexible Work Schedule, Staff is accomodating, Excellent Bonus/Reward System in place. CEO friendly & straightforward.
cons: Can feel isolated by others & ignored at times.

pros: Friendly friends and co-workers, free coffees, music in the restrooms, office closing sale and give staff good deals.
cons: Benefits dropped like a meteor falling down to earth. Your life insurance now only 1 time salary, it used to be five times. It means they see your live is cheap. Many other strict rules are coming, including dress code like a clown. Check other reviews before riding the meteor

pros: Great co-workers; professional development is encouraged; family-oriented environment; cross training is supported.
cons: Business development - need to win more contracts to sustain company

job_title: Care Improvement Specialist in Cary, NC
pros:
Job flexibility
Opportunities to work from home
Great coworkers
Engaging work
cons:
Lack of growth opportunities
Recent job cuts
Recent cut to benefits
Negative workplace culture

review_title: Progressive management style and relaxed work culture
pros: Low pressure non-profit work environment
cons: Projects lack meaning and measurable positive impact on society

job_title: Software Development Engineer in Cary, NC
pros: Was great before management changes.
cons: New management changing culture for the worse.

pros: flexible, good benefits, no other pros
cons: poor pay, good ole boys club
